alert.note: Alert for Dickey; LaMoure; Stutsman (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 11:43AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Bismarck ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Dakota... James River at Lamoure affecting Stutsman, LaMoure and Dickey Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Lamoure. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.7 feet, Rising water begins to affect the city of LaMoure`s sewer system. Water restrictions have been used in the past to counteract these effects. At 14.0 feet, Urban flood stage. At 15.0 feet, Water starts to threaten the northwest side of town near the John Deere dealer. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday morning and crest over the weekend around 14.5 feet. The river is expected to remain above flood stage through the weekend. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 04/06/2011. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
